-webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980=</span><br><span>392);"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Tax Extende=</span><br><span>r Negotiations &amp;nbsp;(&lt;a href=3D"x-apple-data-detectors://26" x-apple-data-d=</span><br><span>etectors=3D"true" x-apple-data-detectors-type=3D"calendar-event" x-apple-dat=</span><br><span>a-detectors-result=3D"26"&gt;Dec. 6&lt;/a&gt;)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=3D"color:=</span><br><span>rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0=</span><br><span>.0980392);"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Brown o=</span><br><span>n HFT &amp;nbsp;(&lt;a href=3D"x-apple-data-detectors://27" x-apple-data-detectors=3D=</span><br><span>"true" x-apple-data-detectors-type=3D"calendar-event" x-apple-data-detectors=</span><br><span>-result=3D"27"&gt;Dec. 4&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.=</span><br><span>701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392);"&gt;&lt;spa=</span><br><span>n style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Shelby 2.0 Update &amp;nbs=</span><br><span>p;(&lt;a href=3D"x-apple-data-detectors://29" x-apple-data-detectors=3D"true" x=</span><br><span>-apple-data-detectors-type=3D"calendar-event" x-apple-data-detectors-result=3D=</span><br><span>"29"&gt;Dec. 3&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -=</span><br><span>webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;div&gt;&lt;span id=3D"docs-internal-guid-4733a1b7-ec8c-3344-1176-d4eb9086feb6"&gt;&lt;=</span><br></blockquote><span>hr style=3D"box-sizing: content-box; border-style: solid; border-color: gray=</span><br><span>; height: 0px;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p clas=</span><br><span>s=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Mi=</span><br><span>ke &amp;amp; Co. --&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-c=</span><br><span>olor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;One week ago, the House passed a bill that co=</span><br><span>uld alter and perhaps ease the way state and local infrastructure is finance=</span><br><span>d in the capital markets, when HR.2209, a bill to&amp;nbsp;"require the appropri=</span><br><span>ate Federal banking agencies to treat certain municipal obligations as level=</span><br><span>2A liquid assets, and for other purposes"&amp;nbsp;was adopted by the House wit=</span><br><span>h a voice vote. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backg=</span><br><span>round-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Thought the bill has flown below the m=</span><br><span>edia radar, it is significant. &amp;nbsp;Municipal obligations, including bonds,=</span><br><span>are at the heart of infrastructure investment in America.&amp;nbsp; And infrast=</span><br><span>ructure investment has been a large focus of this primary.&amp;nbsp; Both Democr=</span><br><span>atic candidates have proposed multi-hundred billion dollar infrastructure in=</span><br><span>vestment proposals.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backgrou=</span><br><span>nd-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Details below...&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"Ms=</span><br><span>oNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Best,&lt;/sp=</span><br><span>an&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;Dana&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span id=3D"docs-internal-guid-47=</span><br><span>33a1b7-ec8c-3344-1176-d4eb9086feb6" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255=</span><br><span>, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;hr style=3D"box-sizing: content-box; border-style: solid; borde=</span><br><span>r-color: gray; height: 0px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"ma=</span><br><span>rgin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;I=</span><br><span>nfrastructure is mostly funded at the state or local level through the use o=</span><br><span>f municipal bonds. &amp;nbsp;Between 2003 and 2012, counties, states, and other l=</span><br><span>ocalities invested $3.2 trillion in infrastructure through long-term tax-exe=</span><br><span>mpt municipal bonds, 2.5 times more than the federal investment. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/spa=</span><br><span>n&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;The Bill&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal=</span><br><span>"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;HR 2209 requires=</span><br><span>federal banking regulators to include municipal bonds under the Liquidity C=</span><br><span>overage Ratio (LCR). &amp;nbsp;The LCR is designed to ensure that financial inst=</span><br><span>itutions have the necessary assets available to handle a liquidity disruptio=</span><br><span>n. &amp;nbsp;Local officials have said that if the new rules aren=E2=80=99t chan=</span><br><span>ged, it will saddle them with higher borrowing costs by eliminating incentiv=</span><br><span>es banks have to purchase their bonds. Without bonds, these governments will=</span><br><span>lose a significant source of their funding. &amp;nbsp;Per Indiana State Treasur=</span><br><span>er Kelly Mitchell: =E2=80=9CThis bill helps ensure cash-strapped school dist=</span><br><span>ricts and municipalities will continue to have access to bonds to finance pr=</span><br><span>ojects they think are best for their communities.=E2=80=9D&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>);"&gt;Rep. Luke Messer, an Indiana Republican who wrote the bill: &amp;nbsp;=E2=80=</span><br><span>=9CPut simply, our bill requires the federal government to recognize the obv=</span><br><span>ious, that our municipal bonds are some of the safest investments in the wor=</span><br><span>ld and that we shouldn=E2=80=99t have rules that give preferential treatment=</span><br><span>to corporate bonds or other countries=E2=80=99 bonds over our own.=E2=80=9D=</span><br><span>&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgb=</span><br><span>a(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;After passing the House with unanimous bipartisan supp=</span><br><span>ort, a companion bill is expected to be introduced in the Senate this year. &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rgba=</span><br><span>(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Municipal Bond Issue&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;After the crisis o=</span><br><span>f 2008, federal regulators adopted international banking standards that requ=</span><br><span>ire banks to have enough "High-Quality Liquid Assets" to cover their cash ou=</span><br><span>tflows for 30 days in case of a future financial meltdown. &amp;nbsp;Now, munici=</span><br><span>pal bonds are not considered liquid assets and therefore cannot be included u=</span><br><span>nder the &amp;nbsp;LCR. &amp;nbsp; As a result, financial institutions have been dis=</span><br><span>couraged from holding municipal debt, which means that cash strapped municip=</span><br><span>alities and school districts may eventually be forced to reduce or even stop=</span><br><span>work on projects &amp;nbsp;financed with municipal bonds.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p cl=</span><br><span>ass=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255,=</span><br><span>0);"&gt;Infrastructure Financing --&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b style=3D"background-col=</span><br><span>or: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Alternative Financing&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"Ms=</span><br><span>oNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;b&gt;=E2=80=</span><br><span>=A2 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;i style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255,=</span><br><span>0);"&gt;Tax-exempt bonds: &amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255,=</span><br><span>255, 255, 0);"&gt;Exemption from federal taxes and many state and local taxes i=</span><br><span>s possible through the use of municipal bonds. &amp;nbsp; In recent years, with t=</span><br><span>he increasing use of PPPs, barriers to this tax exemption have arisen. &amp;nbsp=</span><br><span>;Treasury has reviewed relevant tax rules and based on their findings and ha=</span><br><span>ve put forth a proposal for an expanded and permanent America Fast Forward B=</span><br><span>ond Program as an alternative to tax-exempt bonds. &amp;nbsp;Based on the succes=</span><br><span>sful Build America Bond program, =E2=80=9Cwould provide an efficient borrowi=</span><br><span>ng subsidy to state and local governments while appealing to a broader inves=</span><br><span>tor base than traditional tax-exempt bonds [and] would cover a broad range o=</span><br><span>f projects for which tax-exempt bonds can be used.=E2=80=9D&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;i style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255=</span><br><span>, 255, 0);"&gt;Obama=E2=80=99s budget proposal: &amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backgr=</span><br><span>ound-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Obama has also put forth a plan to stre=</span><br><span>ngthen local and state government infrastructure projects. His plan relies o=</span><br><span>n a new Federal credit program to support public-private partnerships within=</span><br><span>the Department of the Treasury. It will provide direct loans to US infrastr=</span><br><span>ucture projects developed through PPPs. The Obama Administration believes th=</span><br><span>at private investment is crucial for infrastructure development moving forwa=</span><br><span>rd, so there should be more flexibility in regards to what PPP is subject to=</span><br><span>. In addition to that, President Obama has proposed the taxable, direct-pay A=</span><br><span>merica Fast Forward bond program to help finance infrastructure. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/spa=</span><br><span>n&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;b style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 25=</span><br><span>5, 0);"&gt;&lt;u&gt;State Infrastructure Banks&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;spa=</span><br><span>n style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Local governments rece=</span><br><span>ive financing in a number of ways. &amp;nbsp;Traditional sources such as tax rev=</span><br><span>enues have been dwindling and local authorities have been relying on federal=</span><br><span>government loan programs, public-private partnerships, and State Revolving =</span><br><span>Funds (SRFs). &amp;nbsp;State Infrastructure Banks (SIBs) are a subset of SRFs -=</span><br><span>- the funds act like a bank, because they don=E2=80=99t own the infrastructu=</span><br><span>re asset, but act as a lender or guarantor to the project sponsor. Per Brook=</span><br><span>ings: &amp;nbsp;=E2=80=9CSRFs rely on principal repayments, bonds, interest and f=</span><br><span>ees to re-capitalize and replenish the fund as a perpetual source of debt fi=</span><br><span>nancing.=E2=80=9D&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background=</span><br><span>-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;SIBs generate more investment per dollar th=</span><br><span>an traditional federal and state grant programs. &amp;nbsp;They only exist in 33=</span><br><span>states and 10 of those SIBs are currently inactive. A large problem may be c=</span><br><span>ompliance with federal regulations. &amp;nbsp;Brookings again:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>);"&gt;=E2=80=9CWe found that many SIB officials cite compliance with federal r=</span><br><span>egulations as slowing down the investment process either because of environm=</span><br><span>ental and contractual requireme&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(=</span><br><span>255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;nts or due to the lack of flexibility in projects that a=</span><br><span>re not Title 23 or 49 eligible. For states with smaller projects, this may b=</span><br><span>e prohibitively costly compared to the advantage of using the low-cost SIB f=</span><br><span>inancing.=E2=80=9D&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"bac=</span><br><span>kground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Just being called a bank subjects SI=</span><br><span>Bs to regulations that commercial banks are subject to. &amp;nbsp;SIBs are non-f=</span><br><span>or-profit organizations with a goal of increasing infrastructure investment,=</span><br><span>so they don=E2=80=99t quite fit into the category of the average bank. &amp;nbs=</span><br><span>p;SIBs may be more successful outside this classification.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span=</span><br><span>style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p cla=</span><br><span>ss=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Fo=</span><br><span>r or Against Dodd-Frank&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"bac=</span><br><span>kground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Before Dodd-Frank, particularly in t=</span><br><span>he case of relatively small municipalities, many underwriters forged long-te=</span><br><span>rm relationships with municipalities and would provide financial advice befo=</span><br><span>re and after a bond issuance. &amp;nbsp;With Dodd-Frank, that relationship chang=</span><br><span>ed, with a new =E2=80=9Cmunicipal adviser=E2=80=9D category that must regist=</span><br><span>er with the SEC and be regulated by the Municipal Securities Rulemaking Boar=</span><br><span>d (MSR).&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)=</span><br><span>;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;No=</span><br><span>w, it is widely illegal to provide advice to governmental entities concernin=</span><br><span>g the issuance of municipal bonds, the use of financial derivatives, and the=</span><br><span>investment of the proceeds of a bond issue to, or on behalf, of a municipal=</span><br><span>entity or an obligated person unless the adviser is registered with the SEC=</span><br><span>.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rg=</span><br><span>ba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;HR 2209 appears to address a problem within Dodd-Fran=</span><br><span>k, but it is unclear if it vitiates the law materially. &amp;nbsp;At face value,=</span><br><span>it appears to be more a technical fix. Dodd-Frank expanded regulations for b=</span><br><span>anking institutions, but the entities that fund state and local governments a=</span><br><span>re far unlike the TBTF institutions that Dodd-Frank was meant to regulate. &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color=</span><br><span>: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Groups like Americans for Financial Reform oppose=</span><br><span>HR 2209: =E2=80=9CWhile we sympathize with the belief that municipal debt w=</span><br><span>as incorrectly treated under the initial LCR rule, we believe that it is ina=</span><br><span>ppropriate to classify such debt as a Level 2A asset. AFR therefore opposes t=</span><br><span>his bill unless a more appropriate liquidity classification is used.=E2=80=9D=</span><br><span>&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;AFR h=</span><br><span>as previously said it supports treating municipal bonds as more liquid and d=</span><br><span>oes not approve the type of classification used in HR 2209, because it goes t=</span><br><span>oo far in its treatment of municipal debt as level 2A liquid assets and spec=</span><br><span>ifically with micromanaging regulators with this kind of detail and they pre=</span><br><span>fer a Level 2B classification.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span s=</span><br><span>tyle=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The bill could provide re=</span><br><span>lief for smaller institutions, so that they can fund infrastructure investme=</span><br><span>nt more easily. In terms of Dodd-Frank, it is yet to be decided if it is sim=</span><br><span>ply a necessary tweak or a criticism.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-=</span><br><span>color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p cl=</span><br><span>ass=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=</span><br><span>Looking Ahead&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-co=</span><br><span>lor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;HR 2209 could end up being an important issue i=</span><br><span>n the national infrastructure discussion. &amp;nbsp;It brings up questions about=</span><br><span>how far a state or local government can go before its activities begin to r=</span><br><span>esemble an actual bank. &amp;nbsp;With the growth of PPPs, the private sector is=</span><br><span>being even more integrated into the process =E2=80=93 should those companie=</span><br><span>s be given tax exemptions, as well?&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/di=</span><br><span>v&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span id=3D"docs-internal-guid-4733a1b7-ec8c-3344-1176-d4eb9086feb6" s=</span><br><span>tyle=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;hr style=3D"box-sizing: c=</span><br><span>ontent-box; border-style: solid; border-color: gray; height: 0px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/=</span><br><span>div&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;Upcoming/Recent Updat=</span><br><span>es&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=</span><br><span>=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;Derivatives Agreement w. EU&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;Bu=</span><br><span>dget (Ir)Resolution&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;Puerto Rico&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=E2=80=A2=</span><br><span>&amp;nbsp;Econ. Revitalization/Housing&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;Infrastructure Financ=</span><br><span>e Update &amp;nbsp;(Feb. 18)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;Does DFA Fail on Too Big to Fail? -webkit-com=</span><br><span>position-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/=</span><br><span>div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 25=</span><br><span>5, 255, 0);"&gt;Mike &amp;amp; Co. &amp;nbsp;--&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span id=3D"docs-=</span><br><span>internal-guid-4733a1b7-ec8c-3344-1176-d4eb9086feb6"&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"=</span><br><span>margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(=</span><br><span>255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; m=</span><br><span>argin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);=</span><br><span>"&gt;The newly-installed&amp;nbsp;the Minneapolis Federal Reserve Bank and former S=</span><br><span>pecial Investigator&amp;nbsp;overseeing the TARP program came to town yesterday a=</span><br><span>dvocating drastic action to head off a financial sector systemic risk crisis=</span><br><span>, calling for&amp;nbsp;the nation\'s biggest banks to be broken up.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>/p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;sp=</span><br><span>an style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;His speech, delivered=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;at Br=</span><br><span>ookings, got noticed, with lengthy coverage in the NYT, WSJ, and WaPo.&amp;nbsp;=</span><br><span>And perhaps with reason -- the TBTF (too big to fail) issue has dogged Cong=</span><br><span>ress and the administration for years and is one of the central ones&lt;/span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;in the Democr=</span><br><span>atic presidential campaign this far.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span id=3D"docs-i=</span><br><span>nternal-guid-4733a1b7-ec8c-3344-1176-d4eb9086feb6"&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"m=</span><br><span>argin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline=</span><br><span>; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Or maybe it was just a slow new=</span><br><span>s day. &amp;nbsp;You decide...&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt=</span><br><span>; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline; background-c=</span><br><span>olor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin=</span><br><span>-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline; bac=</span><br><span>kground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Best,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D=</span><br><span>"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseli=</span><br><span>ne; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Dana&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr"=</span><br><span>style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-alig=</span><br><span>n: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;hr s=</span><br><span>tyle=3D"box-sizing: content-box; border-style: solid; border-color: gray; he=</span><br><span>ight: 0px;"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;b style=3D"backg=</span><br><span>round-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;u&gt;A Peculiar Package of Proposals&lt;/u&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"ba=</span><br><span>ckground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Kashkari argued in the alternative t=</span><br><span>hat Dodd-Frank needs to be used and/or needs to be reformed. &amp;nbsp;He says t=</span><br><span>he law as written does not solve the TBTF problem. &amp;nbsp;He also wants regul=</span><br><span>ators to use the yet-untried tools at their disposal under the law. &amp;nbsp;&amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=9C=</span><br><span>While significant progress has been made to strengthen our financial system,=</span><br><span>I believe the [Dodd-Frank] Act did not go far enough." &amp;nbsp;He then laid o=</span><br><span>ut three ideas meant to end TBTF once and for all. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=</span><br><span>=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;break up large banks into smaller, l=</span><br><span>ess connected, less important entities;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" sty=</span><br><span>le=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255=</span><br><span>, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;turn what remains of the large banks into public util=</span><br><span>ities by forcing them to hold so much capital that they can=E2=80=99t fail; a=</span><br><span>nd&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;tax leverage thr=</span><br><span>oughout the financial system "to reduce systemic risks wherever they lie."&lt;/=</span><br><span>span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;b style=3D"back=</span><br><span>ground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;&lt;u&gt;Break&amp;nbsp;up the B=</span><br><span>anks&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; vertical-a=</span><br><span>lign: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=46rom=</span><br><span>the perspective of current laws, breaking up big banks is already a policy a=</span><br><span>venue available to regulators.&amp;nbsp; The Federal Reserve, through the Financ=</span><br><span>ial Stability Oversight Council, can elect to take a number of actions to de=</span><br><span>al with banks that it feels are both systemically important and organized in=</span><br><span>an unstable way.&amp;nbsp; Section 121 of the Dodd-Frank Act gives the Board of=</span><br><span>Governors these powers.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 1=</span><br><span>2pt 0in; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(25=</span><br><span>5, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;So this first proposal =E2=80=93 break up big banks - has&amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;been covered here before but just for the sake of argument... which ban=</span><br><span>ks need to be broken up most urgently? &amp;nbsp;Few commentators believe there i=</span><br><span>s an imminent threat demanding action. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNorma=</span><br><span>l" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"back=</span><br><span>ground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Unsurprisingly, the Fed doesn=E2=80=99=</span><br><span>t believe that banks are so hopeless that they need to be dissolved. &amp;nbsp;T=</span><br><span>hat doesn=E2=80=99t mean it=E2=80=99s not a possibility under current legisl=</span><br><span>ation, however.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; v=</span><br><span>ertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;b style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 0);"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Make Banks =E2=80=9CUtilities=E2=80=9D&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"Ms=</span><br><span>oNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The second proposal is to push c=</span><br><span>apital requirements for banks so high that they =E2=80=9Cessentially turn in=</span><br><span>to public utilities.=E2=80=9D&amp;nbsp; Kashkari never explains how exactly high=</span><br><span>capital reserves turn banks into utilities, but that=E2=80=99s for another t=</span><br><span>ime.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in;=</span><br><span>vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 0);"&gt;He is voicing his support for one of the oldest forms of banking re=</span><br><span>gulations that we still use and use far more now in the Dodd-Frank era =E2=80=</span><br><span>=93 he wants banks to hold more capital. &amp;nbsp;Supporters of the law may be h=</span><br><span>eartened by his full-throated endorsement of the law on this score.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/s=</span><br><span>pan&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; vertical-align: ba=</span><br><span>seline;"&gt;&lt;b style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Crib=</span><br><span>bing from Clinton?&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0=</span><br><span>in; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 25=</span><br><span>5, 255, 0);"&gt;The third proposal was just about lifted out of Secretary Clint=</span><br><span>on=E2=80=99s plan to regulate Wall Street =E2=80=93- though the reporting on=</span><br><span>the speech doesn=E2=80=99t much mention it much.&amp;nbsp; It is reasonable bot=</span><br><span>h from a policy and a political perspective. But he doesn\'t provide further d=</span><br><span>etails about &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);=</span><br><span>"&gt;his proposal after first outlining it.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;b style=3D"background-c=</span><br><span>olor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Kashkari contra Yellen&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"Mso=</span><br><span>Normal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Fed Chair Yellen has been an out=</span><br><span>spoken proponent of existing banking regulations, making it known that while=</span><br><span>the job of regulators is not done yet. we=E2=80=99re in a much better situa=</span><br><span>tion now than we were before DFA. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-col=</span><br><span>or: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;During her testimony before House Financial Ser=</span><br><span>vices, Yellen fielded a question about why she had not yet broken up big ban=</span><br><span>ks, saying&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;:=</span><br><span>&amp;nbsp;=E2=80=9C=E2=80=A6we [at the Fed]vare using our powers to make sure th=</span><br><span>at a systemically important institution could fail, and it would not be -- h=</span><br><span>ave systemic consequences for the country. We\'re doing that in a whole varie=</span><br><span>ty of ways.=E2=80=9D&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"m=</span><br><span>argin: 12pt 0in; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color:=</span><br><span>rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The ways Yellen is referring to include enforcing L=</span><br><span>iquidity Coverage Ratios, capital reserve requirements, and a rule passed la=</span><br><span>st November forcing the biggest banks to issue long-term debt equal to 18 pe=</span><br><span>rcent of risk-weighted assets. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=</span><br><span>=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Evidently it\'s not enough. &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;But it is nonetheless uncommon for&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba=</span><br><span>(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;a newly minted Federal Reserve Bank President to t=</span><br><span>aking to task the Chair of the Federal Reserve=E2=80=99s Board of Governors.=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin: 12pt 0in; vertical-align:=</span><br><span>baseline;"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;Upcoming/Recent Updates&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=E2=80=A2=</span><br><span>&amp;nbsp;Municipal Bond Rule&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;Budget (Ir)Resolution&lt;/=</span><br><span>div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;Puerto Rico&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;Derivatives A=</span><br><span>greement w. margin-top: 0pt; margin-botto=</span><br><span>m: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;The Cus=</span><br><span>toms Bill: &amp;nbsp;Comity on the Hill&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"ba=</span><br><span>ckground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;=</span><br><span>"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;The Senate cleared the first ove=</span><br><span>rhaul of the Customs and Border Protection (CBP) agency in more than a decad=</span><br><span>e in a 75-20 vote last Thursday, sending the bill to the President and endin=</span><br><span>g months of wrangling over the measure.&amp;nbsp; The &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href=3D"<a href="http://w=">http://w=</a></span><br><span><a href="http://ww.finance.senate.gov/legislation/details/hr-644">ww.finance.senate.gov/legislation/details/hr-644</a>" style=3D"text-decoration: n=</span><br><span>one;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;=</span><br><span>Trade Facilitation and Trade Enforcement Act of 2015&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt; (H.R. 644) retools CBP to increase its focus on=</span><br><span>blocking illegal trade and ensuring that legal trade moves smoothly.&lt;/span&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin=</span><br><span>-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt; &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255=</span><br><span>, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: b=</span><br><span>aseline;"&gt;The major facets of this legislation are: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D=</span><br><span>"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; ma=</span><br><span>rgin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp=</span><br><span>;new protections on intellectual property rights&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bot=</span><br><span>tom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;new too=</span><br><span>ls to fight currency manipulation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"backgrou=</span><br><span>nd-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;spa=</span><br><span>n style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;=E2=80=A2. a permanent extension of th=</span><br><span>e Internet Tax Freedom Act&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-=</span><br><span>color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span s=</span><br><span>tyle=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Said Senate Finance ranking member Ron Wy=</span><br><span>den: &amp;nbsp;=E2=80=9CThis bill is about coming down hard on the trade cheats w=</span><br><span>ho are ripping off American jobs, and the truth is past trade policies were o=</span><br><span>ften too old, too slow or too weak for our country to fight back."&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margi=</span><br></blockquote><span>n-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;W=</span><br><span>yden was perhaps the most outspoken Democrat in support of the bill, continu=</span><br><span>ing his role as a strong backer of free trade legislation.&amp;nbsp; He was a ke=</span><br><span>y factor in getting Trade Promotion Authority legislation passed through Con=</span><br><span>gress last summer, splitting from some of his colleagues in voicing support f=</span><br><span>or that act.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(25=</span><br><span>5, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"font-w=</span><br><span>eight: 700; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Unusual C=</span><br><span>oalition&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;a href=3D"<a href="http://www.sen=">http://www.sen=</a></span><br><span><a href="http://ate.gov/legislative/LIS/roll_call_lists/roll_call_vote_cfm.cfm?&amp;amp;congress=">ate.gov/legislative/LIS/roll_call_lists/roll_call_vote_cfm.cfm?&amp;amp;congress=</a></span><br><span>=3D114&amp;amp;session=3D2&amp;amp;vote=3D00022" style=3D"text-decoration: none;"&gt;&lt;s=</span><br><span>pan style=3D"text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;27 Democ=</span><br><span>rats, 47 Republicans, and 1 Independent voted affirmatively&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span s=</span><br><span>tyle=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;.&amp;nbsp; Industry groups including the Nat=</span><br><span>ional Retail Federation, as well as the U.S. Chamber of Commerce were suppor=</span><br><span>tive of the legislation. &amp;nbsp;National Association of Manufacturers=E2=80=99=</span><br><span>president Jay Timmons said =E2=80=9Cif senators want to grow manufacturing i=</span><br><span>n the United States, then they should pass this bill immediately.=E2=80=9D&lt;/=</span><br><span>span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: base=</span><br><span>line;"&gt;Notable =E2=80=9CNay=E2=80=9D votes include Sens. Durbin and Reid, wh=</span><br><span>o both expressed disappointment that the legislation was a =E2=80=9Cwatered d=</span><br><span>own=E2=80=9D version of a bill previously passed by the Senate. &amp;nbsp;=E2=80=</span><br><span>=9DI like that [Senate] version, and that strong language on currency manipu=</span><br><span>lation,=E2=80=9D Durbin said =E2=80=93 that language required Commerce to co=</span><br><span>nsider =E2=80=9Cundervalued=E2=80=9D currencies to be equivalent to counterv=</span><br><span>ailable subsidies. &amp;nbsp;=E2=80=9CThe conference report that=E2=80=99s back t=</span><br><span>o us now and before the Senate at this moment is a much different bill."&lt;/sp=</span><br><span>an&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);=</span><br><span>margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"font-weight: 700; text=</span><br><span>-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Purpose and Provisions&lt;/s=</span><br><span>pan&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)=</span><br><span>; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: basel=</span><br><span>ine;"&gt;House and Senate negotiators agreed on a final customs bill in Decembe=</span><br><span>r. &amp;nbsp; The House passed the measure 256-158 but the legislation stalled i=</span><br><span>n the Senate over a provision added in conference that permanently extends a=</span><br><span>moratorium on Internet access taxes. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0=</span><br><span>pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;That provision is perhaps the=</span><br><span>most reported on section in the bill =E2=80=93 it=E2=80=99s almost certainl=</span><br><span>y the most popular - it applies to localities, states, and the federal gover=</span><br><span>nment itself. &amp;nbsp; Sen. Lamar Alexander cited it though as explanation for=</span><br><span>his =E2=80=9Cnay=E2=80=9D vote: "t&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;he federal government shouldn\'t be telling the state=</span><br><span>s what their tax structure should be."&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0=</span><br><span>pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Another important provision, k=</span><br><span>nown as the ENFORCE Act, would require the CBP to more aggressively investig=</span><br><span>ate complaints that companies are evading anti-dumping or countervailing dut=</span><br><span>ies on imports by mislabeling or disguising the shipments.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p d=</span><br><span>ir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0p=</span><br><span>t; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;The bill i=</span><br><span>ncludes a new Trade Enforcement Fund to bring trade cases through the WTO, t=</span><br><span>o investigate the implementation of trade requirements by other countries, a=</span><br><span>nd to respond to complaints of trade violations. &amp;nbsp;It&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;also creates a nine-member=</span><br><span>Advisory Committee on International Exchange Rate Policy, whose members mus=</span><br><span>t be comprised of individuals from the private sector who are selected by bo=</span><br><span>th chambers of Congress and the President (three members each).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;b=</span><br><span>r&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-t=</span><br><span>op: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"font-weight: 700; text-decorati=</span><br><span>on: underline; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Currency Manipulation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;b=</span><br><span>r&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-t=</span><br><span>op: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Curr=</span><br><span>ency manipulation has been a long-standing concern of American policy-makers=</span><br><span>and a particularly contentious issue in global trade relations; claims that=</span><br><span>China has been chronically undervaluing its currency have made the news for=</span><br><span>a number of years.&amp;nbsp; Advocates for stricter enforcement of currency man=</span><br><span>ipulation provisions claim that undervalued currencies operate similarly to e=</span><br><span>xport subsidies =E2=80=93 a prohibited practice within the World Trade Organ=</span><br><span>ization.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-a=</span><br><span>lign: baseline;"&gt;The final bill dropped a Senate provision that would have r=</span><br><span>equired the Commerce Department to treat undervalued currency as an illegal s=</span><br><span>ubsidy under U.S. countervailing duty law.&amp;nbsp; This provision would have o=</span><br><span>pened the door for compensatory tariffs to be levied against goods which ori=</span><br><span>ginate from countries which are found to purposely undervalue their currency=</span><br><span>in order to boost their exports. The bill does, however, include other meas=</span><br><span>ures that give the Treasury Department new tools to fight currency manipulat=</span><br><span>ion:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255,=</span><br><span>0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-co=</span><br><span>lor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span sty=</span><br><span>le=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;creates a s=</span><br><span>pecial fund for the CBP to ensure trading partners follow the rules and to b=</span><br><span>ring disputes before the WTO&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-co=</span><br><span>lor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span sty=</span><br><span>le=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;increases f=</span><br><span>unding to the National Intellectual Property Rights Coordination Center&lt;/spa=</span><br><span>n&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); marg=</span><br><span>in-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255,=</span><br><span>255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;establishes the Commercial Customs Operation=</span><br><span>s Advisory Committee jointly between CBP and Treasury&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"lt=</span><br><span>r" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margi=</span><br><span>n-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=</span><br><span>=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;requires CBP to investigate claims from other agencies of evasi=</span><br><span>on of anti-dumping or countervailing duties.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bot=</span><br><span>tom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;b&gt;Relation to TPP&lt;/=</span><br><span>b&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255=</span><br><span>, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-ali=</span><br><span>gn: baseline;"&gt;Sen. Majority Leader McConnell has said that the Senate will n=</span><br><span>ot vote on the Trans-Pacific Partnership before the November elections, so i=</span><br><span>t may come as a surprise to see a bill which deals with enforcing trade deal=</span><br><span>s like TPP pass both houses of Congress.&amp;nbsp; However this bill=E2=80=99s p=</span><br><span>rovisions for protecting IP rights, toughening countervailing duties, and ta=</span><br><span>ckling currency manipulation are a necessary prerequisite for agreements lik=</span><br><span>e TPP (or the far more nebulous TTIP).&amp;nbsp; The new age of trade agreements=</span><br><span>&amp;nbsp;will deal extensively in issues like intellectual property protection=</span><br><span>, trade in services, and high-tech product trading; types of commerce which a=</span><br><span>re far more difficult to regulate compared to the trade of physical goods. &lt;=</span><br><span>/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>); margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: base=</span><br><span>line;"&gt;So, despite the fact that TPP won=E2=80=99t get a vote until after No=</span><br><span>vember (and perhaps not in 2016 at all), and may not pass even then, the pro=</span><br><span>tections set forward in the customs bill are necessary to allow American com=</span><br><span>panies to continue to compete in the global marketplace.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p di=</span><br><span>r=3D"ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt=</span><br><span>; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"font-weight: 700; text-decoration: und=</span><br><span>erline; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Price of Passage&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"=</span><br><span>ltr" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); margin-top: 0pt; mar=</span><br><span>gin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;In order to incl=</span><br><span>ude the permanent extension of the Internet Tax Freedom Act, McConnell had t=</span><br><span>o promise that a vote would be held this year on the Marketplace Fairness Ac=</span><br><span>t.&amp;nbsp; That legislation grants states greater authority to collect sales t=</span><br><span>axes from online businesses who sell products within their borders.&amp;nbsp; Wh=</span><br><span>ile McConnell himself opposes the bill, it was the only way to get the custo=</span><br><span>ms bill (with the tax amendment attached) unstuck.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span style=</span><br><span>=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0); vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;Jus=</span><br><span>t because McConnell has promised it will be brought to a vote doesn=E2=80=99=</span><br><span>t mean it will be a smooth process - the Senate passed the Marketplace Fairn=</span><br><span>ess Act in 2013 with 69 votes, and most of the lawmakers who voted for it ar=</span><br><span>e still in the chamber.&amp;nbsp; Some lawmakers like Kelly Ayotte, who is facin=</span><br><span>g a tough reelection campaign this year, have vowed to fight tooth-and-nail a=</span><br><span>gainst it.&amp;nbsp; Despite these detractors in the Senate, the real battle may=</span><br><span>occur in the House, where two competing proposals have been brought forward=</span><br><span>. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;hr style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0=</span><br><span>, 0, 0.701961); Reg.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;(Dec. 29) &amp;nb=</span><br><span>sp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Omnibus R=</span><br><span>eview (Dec. 15)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0);"&gt;Omnibus Situation &amp;nbsp;(Dec. 14)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=</span><br><span>=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;FY 2016 Omnibus Talks (Dec. 1=</span><br><span>0)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);=</span><br><span>"&gt;Customs Bill &amp;nbsp;(Dec. 8)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-col=</span><br><span>or: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Tax Extender Negotiations &amp;nbsp;(Dec. 6)&amp;nbsp;&lt;=</span><br><span>/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;B=</span><br><span>rown on HFT &amp;nbsp;(Dec. 4)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color:=</span><br><span>rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Shelby 2.0 Update &amp;nbsp;(Dec. 3)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255,=</span><br></blockquote><span>0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;On Feb 10, 2016, at 7:41 PM, Dana &amp;lt;&lt;a hre=</span><br><span>f=3D"<a href="mailto:danachasin@gmail.com">mailto:danachasin@gmail.com</a>"&gt;<a href="mailto:danachasin@gmail.com">danachasin@gmail.com</a>&lt;/a&gt;&amp;gt; wrote:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;/div&gt;&lt;blockquote type=3D"cite"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;meta http-equiv=3D"content-type" cont=</span><br></blockquote><span>ent=3D"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;meta http-e=</span><br><span>quiv=3D"content-type" content=3D"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/sp=</span><br><span>an&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;meta http-equiv=3D"content-type" content=3D"text/html; charse=</span><br><span>t=3Dutf-8"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;meta http-equiv=3D"content-type" co=</span><br><span>ntent=3D"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span=</span><br><span>style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Mike &amp;amp; Co. --&lt;/span=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;br&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br></blockquote><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The Chair of the Federal Reserve=</span><br><span>went before House Financial Services to provide a report on the nation\'s ec=</span><br><span>onomic condition, a kind of bi-annual checkup. No news was made, no firework=</span><br><span>s went off and no market mood swings occurred.&amp;nbsp; As for the Fed\'s next m=</span><br><span>ove, it\'s wait-and-see a little while longer.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"Ms=</span><br><span>oNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color:=</span><br><span>rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;We thought it might happen in March, signs pointed=</span><br><span>to it.&amp;nbsp; Now, the guess is June (sound familiar?) &amp;nbsp;For details, do=</span><br><span>n\'t wait, see below.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom=</span><br><span>: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Best,=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/spa=</span><br><span>n&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Dana&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D=</span><br><span>"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-col=</span><br><span>or: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;----------&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" sty=</span><br><span>le=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0);"&gt;Economic Checkup&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"ma=</span><br><span>rgin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255,=</span><br><span>0);"&gt;Fed Chair Yellen testified before House Financial Services this mornin=</span><br><span>g for the Federal Reserve=E2=80=99s bi-annual Monetary Policy Report.&amp;nbsp; T=</span><br><span>hese appearances allow Yellen to explain the Fed=E2=80=99s, actually the Fed=</span><br><span>eral Open Market Committee (FOMC)=E2=80=99s, analysis and projections regard=</span><br><span>ing America\'s economic performance as well as to signal the factors underlyi=</span><br><span>ng its actions in the months ahead. &amp;nbsp;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNorm=</span><br><span>al" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba=</span><br><span>(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The rate change in December 2015 was the first time the=</span><br><span>Fed raised rates since 2006 -- some worry that even a modest increase in ra=</span><br><span>tes at this juncture would&amp;nbsp;further&amp;nbsp;slow&amp;nbsp;already limited&amp;nbsp;=</span><br><span>economic&amp;nbsp;growth&amp;nbsp;after years of uncertainty.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"=</span><br><span>MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-colo=</span><br><span>r: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;The Basics&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D=</span><br><span>"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-col=</span><br><span>or: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The bottom line: the FOMC won=E2=80=99t rollbac=</span><br><span>k rates in March and it=E2=80=99s not likely to raise them either.&amp;nbsp; The=</span><br><span>Fed likes what it sees in the labor market, wage growth looks strong, and e=</span><br><span>merging market missteps continue to be a threat to the US economy but perhap=</span><br><span>s not an immediate one.&amp;nbsp; The next rate move is almost certain to be an i=</span><br><span>ncrease but it could wait until June or later.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"M=</span><br><span>soNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color=</span><br><span>: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Yellen reiterated much of the FOMC statement from=</span><br><span>last month: &amp;nbsp;the labor market remains strong, but shows some signs of r=</span><br><span>emaining slack, that the low inflation we have seen is caused by =E2=80=9Ctr=</span><br><span>ansitory=E2=80=9D effects (low energy prices), and that global market uncert=</span><br><span>ainty creates some level of risk for slow growth at home and abroad.&amp;nbsp; T=</span><br><span>hough Yellen did not make a prediction on how long these transitory market e=</span><br><span>ffects would last, a number of forecasts for oil prices show the dip lasting=</span><br><span>through 2016.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt=</span><br><span>;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Expanding on gl=</span><br><span>obal growth issues, Yellen said "These developments, if they prove persisten=</span><br><span>t, could weigh on the outlook for economic activity and the labor market, al=</span><br><span>though declines in longer-term interest rates and oil prices could provide s=</span><br><span>ome offset," she added: "Foreign economic developments, in particular, pose r=</span><br><span>isks to US economic growth."&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D=</span><br><span>"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>);"&gt;Partisan Review&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom=</span><br><span>: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The GOP i=</span><br><span>s generally critical of "accommodative" (lower) Fed rates.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; High-=</span><br><span>net-worth individuals benefit the most from high rates through dividends and=</span><br><span>interest from savings.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Low rates allow more growth for the middl=</span><br><span>e- and lower-classes&amp;nbsp;at the risk of inflation,&amp;nbsp;tacitly supporting D=</span><br><span>emocrats=E2=80=99 progressive fiscal policy goals.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Some conservat=</span><br><span>ive economists have gone so far as to blame low interest rates pushed by the=</span><br><span>Fed in the 1990=E2=80=99s for the market meltdown in 2007, claiming that ch=</span><br><span>eap credit was the cause of the overheated housing market.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p clas=</span><br><span>s=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-col=</span><br><span>or: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Strong Labor Market&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoN=</span><br><span>ormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(=</span><br><span>255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Discussing the labor market in greater detail, Yellen po=</span><br><span>inted to the cumulative increase in employment since 2010 of 13 million jobs=</span><br><span>.&amp;nbsp; The rate in January fell to 4.9 percent, 0.8 points below its level o=</span><br><span>ne year ago; measures of labor market conditions such as the number of peopl=</span><br><span>e who are working part-time but want to move to full-time positions and the n=</span><br><span>umber of individuals who want to work but haven=E2=80=99t searched recently a=</span><br><span>re also decreasing steadily.&amp;nbsp; Regarding these broader labor market indi=</span><br><span>cators Yellen testified that =E2=80=9C=E2=80=A6&amp;nbsp;these measures remain a=</span><br><span>bove the levels seen prior to the recession, suggesting that some slack in l=</span><br><span>abor markets remains. Thus, while labor market conditions have improved subs=</span><br><span>tantially, there is still room for further sustainable improvement."&lt;/span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"back=</span><br><span>ground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Forward Guidance&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D=</span><br><span>"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;As always, Yellen was careful not to give hints on w=</span><br><span>hat the Fed is planning to do in future meetings; speaking on the path forwa=</span><br><span>rd for the Fed Funds rate Yellen said =E2=80=9COf course, monetary policy is=</span><br><span>by no means on a preset course. The actual path of the federal funds rate w=</span><br><span>ill depend on what incoming data tell us about the economic outlook, and we w=</span><br><span>ill regularly reassess what level of the federal funds rate is consistent wi=</span><br><span>th achieving and maintaining maximum employment and 2 percent inflation.=E2=80=</span><br><span>=9D&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Yellen was asked about the=</span><br><span>chances of the FOMC rolling back the rate hike it announced in December: &amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp;"I do not expect the FOMC is going to be soon in the situation where it\'=</span><br><span>s necessary to cut rates If the FOMC delayed the start of policy normalizati=</span><br><span>on for too long, it might have to tighten policy relatively abruptly in the f=</span><br><span>uture to keep the economy from overheating and inflation from significantly o=</span><br><span>vershooting its objective. Such an abrupt tightening could increase the risk=</span><br><span>of pushing the economy into recession."&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNorm=</span><br><span>al" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rgba(255=</span><br><span>, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Comment on Dodd-Frank&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" sty=</span><br><span>le=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 0);"&gt;During the Q&amp;amp;A portion of her testimony, Yellen was asked about=</span><br><span>financial regulation, both in terms of breaking up the banks and enforcing t=</span><br><span>he regulations brought on by Dodd-Frank.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNorm=</span><br><span>al" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255=</span><br><span>, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;In response to being asked if the Fed is trying to break up=</span><br><span>the banks, she responded:&amp;nbsp;"We are using our powers to make sure that a=</span><br><span>systemically important institution could fail, and it would not have system=</span><br><span>ic consequences for the country." Her answer was interesting, because she\'s n=</span><br><span>ot outright saying the banks will be broken up or reduced, just that the Fed=</span><br><span>is trying to ensure that even if they did fail, it wouldn\'t negatively effe=</span><br><span>ct the economy.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11p=</span><br><span>t;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Yellen was als=</span><br><span>o asked about the burden of new Dodd-Frank regulations on banks. She respond=</span><br><span>ed: "For our part, we\'re focused on doing everything that we conceivably can=</span><br><span>to minimize and reduce the burden on these banking organizations. We\'ve bee=</span><br><span>n conducting an EGRPRA&amp;nbsp;review to identify potential burdens that our re=</span><br><span>gulations impose." An EGRPRA review is connected to the Economic Growth and R=</span><br><span>egulatory Paperwork Reduction Act, which requires regulations imposed on fin=</span><br><span>ancial institutions to be reviewed by the agencies at least once every 10 ye=</span><br><span>ars. The purpose is to prevent&amp;nbsp;burdensome&amp;nbsp;regulations that could h=</span><br><span>inder a&amp;nbsp;bank\'s ability to serve its customers.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=</span><br><span>=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-colo=</span><br><span>r: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The Bottom Line&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal=</span><br><span>" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0);"&gt;Fed watchers make their living by trying to predict what the FO=</span><br><span>MC will or won=E2=80=99t do at their meetings, and on days when Yellen is sc=</span><br><span>heduled to testify before Congress you can bet that they=E2=80=99re listenin=</span><br><span>g intently.&amp;nbsp; While Yellen was careful not to project the Fed=E2=80=99s m=</span><br><span>oves, the general sentiment in the markets is that FOMC won=E2=80=99t be rai=</span><br><span>sing rates at its March meeting.&amp;nbsp; The CME Group FedWatch tool, which es=</span><br><span>timates FOMC rate hikes based on its futures prices, predicts a 95% probabil=</span><br><span>ity that the Fed will maintain its current rate target in March.&amp;nbsp; Some f=</span><br><span>orecasters go even further -- expecting that the funds rate won=E2=80=99t be=</span><br><span>raised all year.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bot=</span><br><span>tom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Trader=</span><br><span>s see the ongoing economic struggles of emerging economies, particularly in C=</span><br><span>hina, as evidence that the Fed won=E2=80=99t continue with its scheduled 4 r=</span><br><span>ate hikes this year.&amp;nbsp; Certainly, considering the testimony today that 1=</span><br><span>) continued emerging market uncertainty can weigh down the US economy and 2)=</span><br><span>that poor performance in the US economy would cause the Fed to change cours=</span><br><span>e on its rate hike schedule, a link between poor emerging market performance=</span><br><span>and fewer Fed rate hikes seems plausible.&amp;nbsp; Certainly the trading on Fe=</span><br><span>d fund futures indicates that the markets believe this is the case.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/=</span><br><span>p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 11pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backg=</span><br><span>round-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;-------&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;Recent Updates&lt;div&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;The Fed Holds Steady &amp;nbsp;(Feb. 10)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;Obama\'s FY17 Bu=</span><br><span>dget &amp;nbsp;(Feb. 9)&amp;nbsp;&lt;div&gt;Tax Talk of the Town &amp;nbsp;(Feb. 3)&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;De=</span><br><span>fending Dodd-Frank &amp;nbsp;(Feb. 2)&lt;br&gt;&lt;div&gt;Fiscal Pol: Deficit/Debt Dormancy (=</span><br><span>Jan. 28)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>The Fed Holds Rates, for Now &amp;nbsp;(Jan. 28)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;Debate Myths C=</span><br></blockquote><span>hallenged &amp;nbsp;(Jan. 25)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;Regulating the Regulators &amp;nbsp;(Jan. 21=</span><br><span>)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;Sanders\' Tax/Healthcare Policy &amp;nbsp;(Jan 20)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(=</span><br><span>130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress;"&gt;HRC\'s Tax Po=</span><br><span>licy &amp;nbsp;(Jan. 17)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961);
