charset=3Dutf-8"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;Mike &amp;amp; Co. --&lt;br&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0);"&gt;Today, President Obama submitted his eighth and final budget p=</span><br><span>roposal to Congress.&amp;nbsp; It tops the $4 trillion mark for the first time. &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Despite the historical tendency for lame duck presidential budget=</span><br><span>s to be treated as scrap paper -- this one won\'t even be accorded the courte=</span><br><span>sy of a hearing in House Budget -- there are a few noteworthy proposals and i=</span><br><span>nitiatives which, if nothing else, are likely to generate discussion on the H=</span><br><span>ill and off. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom:=</span><br><span>0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;That=E2=</span><br><span>=80=99s the real purpose of this budget -- to help frame the debate in 2016 a=</span><br><span>bout where America is headed what the nation\'s priorities should be.&amp;nbsp; A=</span><br><span>number of the proposals in this budget resonate with issues and themes alre=</span><br><span>ady being debated.&amp;nbsp; Candidates in particular seeking to emphasize suppo=</span><br><span>rt for or opposition to the President have a new set of proposals at their d=</span><br><span>isposal.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.00=</span><br><span>01pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;What is new=</span><br><span>and noteworthy in the White House budget and what\'s next for it? &amp;nbsp;Deta=</span><br><span>il below.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0=</span><br><span>001pt;"&gt;Special thanks to those of you in NH tonight. &amp;nbsp;Fingers crossed a=</span><br><span>nd stay tuned this way: &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href=3D"<a href="http://politi.co/20n5W2w">http://politi.co/20n5W2w</a>"&gt;htt=</span><br><span>p://politi.co/20n5W2w&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bo=</span><br><span>ttom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;B=</span><br><span>est,&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;sp=</span><br><span>an style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Dana&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p cla=</span><br><span>ss=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backgroun=</span><br><span>d-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;---------&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"=</span><br><span>style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(25=</span><br><span>5, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The Obama Administration put forth a myriad of budget prop=</span><br><span>osals revolving around a variety of issues. &amp;nbsp;Below are thoughts on some=</span><br><span>of the most significant of these from a fiscal and financial regulatory per=</span><br><span>spective:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;blockquote style=3D"margin: 0px 0px 0px 40px; bor=</span><br><span>der: none; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0=</span><br><span>001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;$10/Barrel Transportation Tax&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNo=</span><br><span>rmal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rg=</span><br><span>ba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;A perennial favorite of Democrats has made a return i=</span><br><span>n the Obama budget: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;a $10.25 per barrel tax on oil, $319 billion in revenue from w=</span><br><span>hich will go toward funding =E2=80=9Ca 21st Century Clean Transportation Pla=</span><br><span>n to upgrade the nation=E2=80=99s transportation system, improve resilience a=</span><br><span>nd reduce emissions." &amp;nbsp;The proposed tax is a simplified version of =E2=80=</span><br><span>=9Ccarbon taxation=E2=80=9D policies, which aim to tax energy producers and o=</span><br><span>il companies based on the level of pollution they produce; =E2=80=9Ccap and t=</span><br><span>rade=E2=80=9D was a similar policy idea but with more complicated implementa=</span><br><span>tion. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001=</span><br><span>pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The tax will b=</span><br><span>e phased in over five years and levied against oil companies, with the reven=</span><br><span>ue to help fund clean energy initiatives like expanding high-speed rail syst=</span><br><span>ems and also to increase national infrastructure spending.&amp;nbsp; The appeal o=</span><br><span>f this flat-tax on oil is its simplicity =E2=80=93- there is nothing complic=</span><br><span>ated about charging oil companies $10.25 per barrel of oil, meaning there=E2=</span><br><span>=80=99s no way for them to shirk the charge.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span class=3D"=</span><br><span>im" style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNorma=</span><br><span>l" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;Supporting the tax would lend candidat=</span><br><span>es some environmental bonafides, but might be seen as a backdoor &amp;nbsp;tax&lt;s=</span><br><span>pan style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;on the middle-=</span><br><span>class. Though paid for by oil companies, the &amp;nbsp;price is expected to be p=</span><br><span>assed along to consumers through higher prices.&amp;nbsp; The tax is expected to=</span><br><span>increase the price of gasoline by 25 cents per gallon.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p c=</span><br><span>lass=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backgro=</span><br><span>und-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Funding Fin. Reg. L=</span><br><span>ike it Matters&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margi=</span><br><span>n-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)=</span><br><span>;"&gt;Obama proposes to double the budget for Wall Street regulators SEC and CFT=</span><br><span>C over ten years, beginning with an 11 percent increase for SEC and 32 perce=</span><br><span>nt for CFTC in 2017.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Clinton has a lot to like in this particular=</span><br><span>section =E2=80=93 she=E2=80=99s the only candidate who has defended Dodd-Fra=</span><br><span>nk and is campaigning on proposals to strengthen current regulations, includ=</span><br><span>ing through greater budgets for&amp;nbsp;regulatory agencies.&amp;nbsp; Leaders for b=</span><br><span>oth regulators have complained that their responsibilities far outstrip thei=</span><br><span>r budget.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 25=</span><br><span>5, 0);"&gt;&lt;span class=3D"im"&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.=</span><br><span>0001pt;"&gt;The proposal is more realistic than the oil tax, although not neces=</span><br><span>sarily something that will definitely be enacted. &amp;nbsp;The SEC has called f=</span><br><span>or increased funding recently.&amp;nbsp; SEC chairman Mary Jo White asked at a H=</span><br><span>ouse Financial Services Committee hearing in November for $1.8 billion in fu=</span><br><span>nding for fiscal 2017. &amp;nbsp;In a time when Republicans are looking to reduc=</span><br><span>e regulatory burdens against banks, an increase in regulators=E2=80=99 budge=</span><br><span>ts highlights the difference in priorities on Wall Street.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>span class=3D"im"&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;=</span><br><span>=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Boosting R and D&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=3D"im"&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;The budget increas=</span><br><span>es R&amp;amp;D funding by four percent for a total of $152 billion in 2017; amon=</span><br><span>g changes are a doubling of clean energy research and funding a $1 billion c=</span><br><span>ancer =E2=80=9CMoonshot=E2=80=9D research program aimed at eliminating the d=</span><br><span>isease.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=3D"im"&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"m=</span><br><span>argin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;=E2=80=A2 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Apprenticeship Training=</span><br><span>Fund&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=3D"im"&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"m=</span><br><span>argin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;The budget establishes a $2 billion mandatory Appre=</span><br><span>nticeship Training Fund =E2=80=93 meant to double the number of apprenticesh=</span><br><span>ips across the United States.&amp;nbsp; Only HRC has talked about the need for i=</span><br><span>ncreasing the number of apprenticeships in the country during the election, f=</span><br><span>avoring a tax-credit policy rather than direct funding.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/sp=</span><br><span>an&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;b=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Congressional Prospe=</span><br></blockquote><span>cts&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;sp=</span><br><span>an style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Obama=E2=80=99s propo=</span><br><span>sal is not only a prelude to battle.&amp;nbsp; Lawmakers and the administration w=</span><br><span>ill have to strike some sort of deal to keep the government running when the=</span><br><span>current fiscal year ends&amp;nbsp;&lt;a&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href=3D"x-apple-data-detectors://9"=</span><br><span>x-apple-data-detectors=3D"true" x-apple-data-detectors-type=3D"calendar-eve=</span><br><span>nt" x-apple-data-detectors-result=3D"9"&gt;on&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span class=3D"" tabinde=</span><br><span>x=3D"0"&gt;&lt;span class=3D""&gt;&lt;a href=3D"x-apple-data-detectors://9" x-apple-data=</span><br><span>-detectors=3D"true" x-apple-data-detectors-type=3D"calendar-event" x-apple-d=</span><br><span>ata-detectors-result=3D"9"&gt;Sept. 30&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;nbsp;=E2=80=94 most li=</span><br><span>kely a continuing resolution to keep the lights on through the election and e=</span><br><span>arly into 2017.&amp;nbsp; In a sign that Obama isn=E2=80=99t looking for a knock=</span><br><span>-down spending fight this year, the president=E2=80=99s proposal abides by t=</span><br><span>he discretionary caps for fiscal 2017 set by last year=E2=80=99s bipartisan b=</span><br><span>udget deal.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span class=3D"im" style=3D"background-color: rg=</span><br><span>ba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom: 0.0001=</span><br><span>pt;"&gt;Congressional leadership may have a fight on its hands even without Oba=</span><br><span>ma making waves =E2=80=93 if the Freedom Caucus membership decides to make i=</span><br><span>ts displeasure on the budget known then it could cause rancor amongst the GO=</span><br><span>P.&amp;nbsp; In a year when the party is desperate to project an image of capabl=</span><br><span>e leadership, in part by passing a complete budget for the first time since 1=</span><br><span>997, a blow-up between Ryan and the back-benchers would amount to nothing le=</span><br><span>ss than catastrophe.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin-bottom=</span><br><span>: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;At a m=</span><br><span>ore granular level, Obama=E2=80=99s blueprint is a grab-bag of Democratic pr=</span><br><span>iorities.&amp;nbsp; The administration is once again calling for expanding early=</span><br><span>education in his 2017 budget, asking for more pre-K grants, a child care ex=</span><br><span>pansion and a small boost to Head Start.&amp;nbsp; The budget boosts spending fo=</span><br><span>r Obamacare Medicaid expansion by $2.6 billion over a decade, designed to be=</span><br><span>an enticement to the 19 holdout states that have yet to take effect.&lt;/span&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0);"&gt;Republicans and the Budget&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The Republicans have a different=</span><br><span>plan for the budget this year, naturally.&amp;nbsp; Speaker Ryan has stated tha=</span><br><span>t he intends to pass the budget and all 12 appropriations through the house -=</span><br><span>- a feat that hasn\'t been accomplished in two decades.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;spa=</span><br><span>n style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The Republicans ha=</span><br><span>ve a different plan for the budget this year, naturally.&amp;nbsp; Speaker Ryan h=</span><br><span>as stated that he intends to pass the budget and all 12 appropriations throu=</span><br><span>gh the house - a feat that hasn\'t been accomplished since 1997.&amp;nbsp; Althou=</span><br><span>gh Ryan and the GOP House leadership hope to gain the faith of the American p=</span><br><span>eople back by bringing about the return of regular order, they face a tight c=</span><br><span>alendar and the political implications of an election year -- not to mention=</span><br><span>internal opposition&lt;b&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;in the form of the Freedom Caucus.&amp;nbsp; Sh=</span><br><span>ould the back-benchers feel their concerns aren=E2=80=99t being adequately a=</span><br><span>ddressed, they may try to disrupt the passage of appropriations bills. &amp;nbsp=</span><br><span>;The care and feeding of these members on budget matters may be turn out to b=</span><br><span>e one of the toughest challenges Ryan will face this year.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>div&gt;-----------------&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0=</span><br><span>, 0.701961); Howev=</span><br><span>er, corporate tax reform at home deals with issues like taxing dividends and=</span><br><span>leveling the playing field between small and large businesses.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-=</span><br><span>composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webk=</span><br><span>it-letterpress; margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=E2=80=A2&amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt;International&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;- Deals wit=</span><br><span>h foreign earnings of American firms abroad. Specifically, current internati=</span><br><span>onal tax reform aims at preventing inversions and coming up with a more succ=</span><br><span>essful way to tax foreign capital earned by American companies, as well as f=</span><br><span>inding ways to encourage companies to move profits home from abroad.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-c=</span><br><span>omposition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webki=</span><br><span>t-letterpress; margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background-color: rg=</span><br><span>ba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Forums for Tax Reform&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNorma=</span><br><span>l" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margin-bo=</span><br><span>ttom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>b&gt;=E2=80=A2 Ways &amp;amp; Means: &amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;Kevin Brady became Chair of the Comm=</span><br><span>ittee in November 2015. &amp;nbsp;The Senate Finance Committee has its focus set on bipartisan workin=</span><br><span>g groups designed to produce tax reform on multiple levels -- individual, co=</span><br><span>rporate, and international. However, there have been many challenges and sta=</span><br><span>lemates along the way because of the stringent partisanship currently ailing=</span><br><span>the Senate.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0=</span><br><span>, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392)=</span><br><span>; text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span styl=</span><br><span>e=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;This election has been defin=</span><br><span>ed, more so than others, by the massively diverse set of tax policies propos=</span><br><span>ed by each candidates =E2=80=93 from flat taxes, capital gains reforms, fina=</span><br><span>ncial transaction taxes and more.&amp;nbsp; Sen. Hatch, Chair of Finance, has al=</span><br><span>ready called for reform efforts in 2016, targeting international corporate r=</span><br><span>ates specifically =E2=80=93 but it=E2=80=99s possible that Brady is trying t=</span><br><span>o shift him and others toward more ambitious proposals. &amp;nbsp;Any high profi=</span><br><span>le move Ryan makes here will likely be a controlling factor on tax policy. &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.70196=</span><br><span>1); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decor=</span><br><span>ation: -webkit-letterpress; margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backgro=</span><br><span>und-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;b&gt;=E2=80=A2&amp;nbsp;Between the Branches -=</span><br><span>-&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;Speaker Ryan and Pres. Obama met yesterday to discuss a variety o=</span><br><span>f issues, one of which was related to the Earned Income Tax Credit. &amp;nbsp;Bo=</span><br><span>th hope to expand the credit to include low-earning workers who DON\'T have c=</span><br><span>hildren. &amp;nbsp;It\'s unclear how successful their cooperation will be, but at=</span><br><span>the very least, they share a common goal.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNo=</span><br><span>rmal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-colo=</span><br><span>r: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margi=</span><br><span>n-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)=</span><br><span>;"&gt;Politico portrayed the meeting as campaign kabuki: =E2=80=9CRather than c=</span><br><span>ut any deals with Obama, Ryan=E2=80=99s hoping to spend 2016 developing what=</span><br><span>he=E2=80=99s calling a detailed GOP agenda on poverty, taxes, health care a=</span><br><span>nd other issues he=E2=80=99s hoping will factor into the presidential campai=</span><br><span>gn and provide a blueprint for House Republicans as they grapple with a new p=</span><br><span>resident next year.=E2=80=9D&amp;nbsp; It=E2=80=99s not surprising to see this g=</span><br><span>iven the pressure this election will put on the new Speaker. &amp;nbsp;He needs t=</span><br><span>o set a strong foundation for his own future, and helping Obama score a tax t=</span><br><span>ouchdown on him is not on the top of his list of objectives. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/=</span><br><span>p&gt;&lt;p style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color=</span><br><span>: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margin=</span><br><span>: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)=</span><br><span>;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-comp=</span><br><span>osition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-l=</span><br><span>etterpress; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba=</span><br><span>(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;During a statement before he met with Obama, Ryan said =E2=</span><br><span>=80=9CWe will take our conservative principles and we will apply those conse=</span><br><span>rvative principles to the problems of the day to offer our fellow citizens s=</span><br><span>olutions to the problems in their daily lives =E2=80=A6. These are not going=</span><br><span>to be things that we will be able to accomplish with this president still i=</span><br><span>n the White House. It is an agenda for what we will do next year with a Repu=</span><br><span>blican president to get our country back on track. This is what 2016=E2=80=99=</span><br><span>s all about. It=E2=80=99s going to be a year of ideas.=E2=80=9D&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p=</span><br><span>style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rg=</span><br><span>ba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margin: 0i=</span><br><span>n 0in 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composit=</span><br><span>ion-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-lette=</span><br><span>rpress; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255=</span><br><span>, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Political Realities&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>p style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margin: 6=</span><br><span>pt 0in;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;William G=</span><br><span>ale and Aaron Krupkin, researchers at Brookings, recently wrote a paper titl=</span><br><span>ed =E2=80=9CMajor Tax Issues in 2016;=E2=80=9D Keeping in mind both the curr=</span><br><span>ent political climate and the probable environment for legislation in 2016, t=</span><br><span>he two researchers write that =E2=80=9CComprehensive tax reform is easy to t=</span><br><span>alk about, but hard to do. The pursuit of sweeping tax simplification is a n=</span><br><span>oble goal, but quixotic.=E2=80=9D &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(=</span><br><span>130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margin-bottom=</span><br><span>: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;At th=</span><br><span>e end of the day 2016 is an election year and any legislative proposals that=</span><br><span>come forward during it will reflect that.&amp;nbsp; There are many exciting pos=</span><br><span>sibilities for tax reform in 2016, but there is also no reason to think that=</span><br><span>the political gridlock that has defined Washington for so long will ease up=</span><br><span>enough while both parties vie for control of the country by drawing contest=</span><br><span>s.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.70=</span><br><span>1961); Co. --&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"=</span><br><span>color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98=</span><br><span>, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;Congratulations, team. &amp;nbsp;&lt;sp=</span><br><span>an style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Last night\'s narrow&amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp;win in Iowa&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;provided a big moral victory and took some of th=</span><br><span>e win out of the challenger\'s sails. &amp;nbsp;It also means&lt;span style=3D"backg=</span><br><span>round-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;that, for at least several weeks=</span><br><span>, the Democratic nomination contest will continue apace. &amp;nbsp;And it is lik=</span><br><span>ely that Wall Street regulation will likely remain one the &amp;nbsp;campaign\'s c=</span><br><span>entral issues. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(=</span><br><span>0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980=</span><br><span>392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0);"&gt;At the heart of this debate is the Dodd-Frank Act (DFA). &amp;nbsp=</span><br><span>; Public opinion is still influenced in the main by memories of the 2008 fin=</span><br><span>ancial crisis and the recession that followed, so the candidates\' views on D=</span><br><span>FA get special attention.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=</span><br><span>=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130=</span><br><span>, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-co=</span><br><span>lor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Below, we re-examine these views and try to cl=</span><br><span>ear up the misconceptions that make it hard for&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"b=</span><br><span>ackground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;voters to identify the candidate b=</span><br><span>est able to defend the protections that&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backgroun=</span><br><span>d-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;DFA provides millions of American consumer=</span><br><span>s, investors, and workers.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"c=</span><br><span>olor: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 9=</span><br><span>8, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color=</span><br><span>: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The assertion that DFA doesn=E2=80=99t do enough t=</span><br><span>o rein in Wall Street has become some sort of progressive shibboleth that as=</span><br><span>misleading as it is short-sighted and self-defeating. &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/=</span><br><span>p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-co=</span><br><span>mposition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;=</span><br><span>"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Polling shows th=</span><br><span>e American public believes strong financial regulation is critically needed (=</span><br><span>74 percent of Democrats, 56 percent Independents, 46 percent Republicans, 64=</span><br><span>percent all voters). &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255=</span><br><span>, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Polling has also shown that 66 percent of Americans are eit=</span><br><span>her =E2=80=9Cnot very familiar=E2=80=9D with or have =E2=80=9Cnever heard of=</span><br><span>=E2=80=9D Dodd-Frank. &amp;nbsp;It&amp;nbsp;is difficult for reasonable dialogue to b=</span><br><span>e conducted in an environment made up of strong support for regulatory refor=</span><br><span>m on one hand and a lack of knowledge of what is in DFA on the other.&lt;/span&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-=</span><br><span>composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001p=</span><br><span>t;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Any public deb=</span><br><span>ate on DFA is hampered by the complexity of the issues involved. &amp;nbsp;Addit=</span><br><span>ionally, there is a perception that it has failed in its objectives. &amp;nbsp;B=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;eyond the f=</span><br><span>act that the law isn=E2=80=99t even fully implemented, major financial insti=</span><br><span>tutions have already begun restructuring&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-col=</span><br><span>or: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;in ways that indicate the law is working p=</span><br><span>roperly.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)=</span><br><span>;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; But how many voters know this?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(=</span><br><span>130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"background=</span><br><span>-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Has Dodd-Frank Worked?&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D=</span><br><span>"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fil=</span><br><span>l-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=</span><br><span>=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The Great Recession and the r=</span><br><span>esulting Dodd-Frank Act changed the trajectory of the financial industry. &amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp;The law isn\'t perfect but it is having a stabilizing effect. &amp;nbsp;Some o=</span><br><span>f the biggest firms on Wall Street -- MetLife, CitiGroup, General Electric -=</span><br><span>- have shrunk since the law was enacted and as a direct result of its regula=</span><br><span>tions. &amp;nbsp;Those that haven\'t shrunk are under even more pressure to break=</span><br><span>up or reduce their size now than they were before Dodd-Frank.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p c=</span><br><span>lass=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composit=</span><br><span>ion-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;spa=</span><br><span>n style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The candidates are spl=</span><br><span>it concerning whether or not DFA is an full and sufficient model for regulat=</span><br><span>ing financial markets. &amp;nbsp;While HRC wants to preserve and protect the pro=</span><br><span>gress made by DFA while bolstering certain parts of the law, while Sanders c=</span><br><span>onsiders the law to be well intentioned yet deeply flawed.&amp;nbsp; However, qu=</span><br><span>estions should be raised about judging the DFA=E2=80=99s efficacy right now -=</span><br><span>each candidate is forming an opinion on the act despite the fact that DFA h=</span><br><span>asn=E2=80=99t even reached maturity yet - only about 70 percent of DFA provi=</span><br><span>sions have been implemented.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Beyond the implementation gap is the=</span><br><span>issue that the results of financial reform cannot be seen overnight.&amp;nbsp; A=</span><br><span>piece of legislation as large and multifaceted as Dodd-Frank might take a d=</span><br><span>ecade to ripen.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(=</span><br><span>0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980=</span><br><span>392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 0);"&gt;Even as the greatest effects of DFA remain to be see, recent e=</span><br><span>vents indicate that DFA is working as it was intended to.&amp;nbsp; Any candidat=</span><br><span>e who claims that DFA is in need of major overhaul needs to answer this ques=</span><br><span>tion: What pressing need is there to overturn a law that has, to this point,=</span><br><span>largely accomplished its overarching objectives?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"backg=</span><br><span>round-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal=</span><br><span>" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u style=3D"backgr=</span><br><span>ound-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;2016 Candidates and Dodd-Frank&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-c=</span><br><span>omposition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt=</span><br><span>;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The candidates i=</span><br><span>n this year\'s primaries have given voters two choices: stick with Dodd-Frank=</span><br><span>and add some tweaks or repeal it/change it fundamentally. There is only one=</span><br><span>candidate in the former group - HRC. Every other candidate, including Berni=</span><br><span>e Sanders, intends to greatly change Dodd-Frank, or get rid of it all togeth=</span><br><span>er, if elected. With that choice in mind, it is necessary to remember how mo=</span><br><span>numental Dodd-Frank was and the political climate that it was passed in - on=</span><br><span>e with a Democratic majority in both houses. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"bac=</span><br><span>kground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNorm=</span><br><span>al" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color:=</span><br><span>rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"back=</span><br><span>ground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;DFA enjoyed widespread support in the=</span><br><span>years immediately following its passage;&amp;nbsp;Clinton needs to ring the ala=</span><br><span>rm bells that her opponents intend to kill off an effective tool for regulat=</span><br><span>ing Wall Street for the sake of trying out unproven strategies that are buil=</span><br><span>t more on ideology than policy.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color:=</span><br><span>rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"c=</span><br><span>olor: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98,=</span><br><span>83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Obviously, most Republican candidates would prefer t=</span><br><span>o do away with Dodd-Frank completely as it is greatly disliked by their bigg=</span><br><span>est supporters. Bernie Sanders proposes something similar to Glass-Steagall,=</span><br><span>but also wants to create a list of the banks that are "too-big-too-fail" an=</span><br><span>d "break them up." He outlined his intentions in legislation he proposed to C=</span><br><span>ongress back in May 2015. Bloomberg Politics notes, "Similar to legislation h=</span><br><span>e introduced in previous years, when Democrats controlled the U.S. Senate, t=</span><br><span>he bill has little chance of advancing." &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p class=3D"MsoNor=</span><br><span>mal" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color=</span><br><span>: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"bac=</span><br><span>kground-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;So voters can decide on strengthenin=</span><br><span>g a law that is already working to reign in Wall Street\'s risks or abandonin=</span><br><span>g it for either less regulation or poorly aimed regulations. Considering the=</span><br><span>historical record of these other reform ideas, how can voters be expected t=</span><br><span>o take those suggestions seriously?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br&gt;On Jan 28, 2=</span><br><span>016, at 8:19 PM, Dana &amp;lt;&lt;a href=3D"<a href="mailto:danachasin@gmail.com">mailto:danachasin@gmail.com</a>"&gt;danachasin=</span><br><span>@<a href="http://gmail.com">gmail.com</a>&lt;/a&gt;&amp;gt; wrote:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;blockquote type=3D"cite"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;meta h=</span><br><span>ttp-equiv=3D"content-type" content=3D"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;meta http-equiv=3D"content-type" content=3D"text/html; What is our medium-long term fiscal outlook, what would the i=</span><br><span>mpact on it of the candidates\' proposals be, and what fiscal issues are most=</span><br><span>likely to arise in the primary debate?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-=</span><br><span>color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-to=</span><br><span>p: 0pt; Candidates issuing calls for increased spending, against this b=</span><br><span>ackdrop, may be called to account. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"=</span><br><span>margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baselin=</span><br><span>e; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" s=</span><br><span>tyle=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align:=</span><br><span>baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Perhaps in recognition=</span><br><span>of this, both HRC and Sen. Sanders have recently and admirably detailed how=</span><br><span>they would use executive actions to enact parts of their revenue packages w=</span><br><span>ithout Congressional support. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: r=</span><br><span>gba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Both have proposed extensive new spending plans as p=</span><br><span>art of their primary platform. however, it may be time for the candidates to=</span><br><span>get serious about the fiscal viability of these plans from a fiscal perspec=</span><br><span>tive.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;b=</span><br><span>r&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span=</span><br><span>style=3D"font-weight: 700; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: base=</span><br><span>line; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Clinton -- Fiscal Stimulus?=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/s=</span><br><span>pan&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span styl=</span><br><span>e=3D"vertical-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;HR=</span><br><span>C has proposed a tax package that will raise federal revenue by $500 billion=</span><br><span>over ten years, to be used for a $350 billion =E2=80=9CCollege Compact=E2=80=</span><br><span>=9D plan, for tax deductions on health care spending, and to fund an ambitio=</span><br><span>us infrastructure investment package. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background=</span><br><span>-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Her spending plans are split between those w=</span><br><span>hich provide short-term economic stimulus and those which are aimed at provi=</span><br><span>ding longer-term boost.&amp;nbsp; Her $250 billion plan to increase infrastructu=</span><br><span>re investment in the country =E2=80=93 paid for by reviving the =E2=80=9CBui=</span><br><span>ld America Bonds=E2=80=9D program and federal revenue -- &amp;nbsp;works on two f=</span><br><span>ronts.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt=</span><br><span>;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D=</span><br><span>"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;First, hiring middle-class worke=</span><br><span>rs in construction, engineering, and the trades the plan puts more money int=</span><br><span>o the hands of people who tend to spend that money quickly.&amp;nbsp; Second, im=</span><br><span>proving roads, bridges, and tunnels in America the plan will make future tra=</span><br><span>nsport of goods more reliable, speedy, and safe, all calculated to spur econ=</span><br><span>omic growth.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255,=</span><br><span>255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom=</span><br><span>: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255,=</span><br><span>255, 255, 0);"&gt;The =E2=80=9CCollege Compact=E2=80=9D aims to forgive studen=</span><br><span>t loans, lower college tuition, and make community colleges tuition-free. &amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp;By removing the burden of debt from young graduates, HRC hopes to free t=</span><br><span>hose people up to begin consuming at a higher rate.&amp;nbsp; The current home-o=</span><br><span>wnership rate for young Americans is distressingly low largely due to their d=</span><br><span>ebt burden after college, HRC would rather young Americans take debt on in a=</span><br><span>n equity-building purchase than spend thirty years repaying their college de=</span><br><span>gree. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;span style=3D"font-weight: 700; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align=</span><br></blockquote><span>: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The Sanders Health Ca=</span><br><span>re Tax Bill&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 2=</span><br></blockquote><span>55, 0);"&gt;Sanders=E2=80=99 $14 trillion spending plan, his =E2=80=9CMedicare f=</span><br><span>or All=E2=80=9D proposal, would require the single largest tax hike in the n=</span><br><span>ation=E2=80=99s history, bringing taxes on the wealthy to levels not seen si=</span><br><span>nce Reagan.&amp;nbsp; These taxes, the size of which already makes them non-star=</span><br><span>ters even among Democrats in Congress, are to be used to enact single-payer h=</span><br><span>ealthcare legislation =E2=80=93 legislation which didn=E2=80=99t even get a v=</span><br><span>ote during a Democratic majority in Obama=E2=80=99s first term. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D=</span><br><span>"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical=</span><br><span>-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Sanders must ho=</span><br><span>pe that the economic efficiency of a single-payer health care plan, which fi=</span><br><span>nds its savings in the reduced role of middle-men and insurance companies, w=</span><br><span>ill result in savings passed onto Americans =E2=80=93 Americans who will, in=</span><br><span>their turn, spend those savings in the economy at large. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span s=</span><br><span>tyle=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr"=</span><br><span>style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-alig=</span><br><span>n: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;He has found politic=</span><br><span>al success in his promise to make colleges and universities in America tuiti=</span><br><span>on-free.&amp;nbsp; The impetus behind this plan is similar to that of Mrs. Clint=</span><br><span>on =E2=80=93 students with lower debt burdens are going to spend a greater p=</span><br><span>ortion of their income on food and entertainment, as well as on equity-inves=</span><br><span>tments like homes. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255=</span><br><span>, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-botto=</span><br><span>m: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"font-weight: 700; text-decoration: underline; vertic=</span><br><span>al-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Campaign Impa=</span><br><span>ct&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span st=</span><br><span>yle=3D"vertical-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;=</span><br><span>The CBO=E2=80=99s federal budget projections released last week indicated th=</span><br><span>at the annual federal deficit will grow to $1.3 trillion by 2026.&amp;nbsp; It=E2=</span><br><span>=80=99s unlikely that the CBO report will be linked to the candidates\' spend=</span><br><span>ing plans in any meaningful way.&amp;nbsp; And to be fair, each candidate has pu=</span><br><span>t forward proposals to raise revenue equivalent to the costs of their plans (=</span><br><span>or at least to the extent that their own analyses can be trusted); this is o=</span><br><span>ften a rarity amongst politicians running for office and they should be appl=</span><br><span>auded for doing so.&amp;nbsp; Because of this, both campaigns can claim that the=</span><br><span>ir proposals will not raise the federal deficit =E2=80=93 it=E2=80=99s unlik=</span><br><span>ely that those claims will remain unchallenged in the future. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;sp=</span><br><span>an style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"=</span><br><span>ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"font-weig=</span><br><span>ht: 700; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);=</span><br><span>"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Tax Foundation Analysis &lt;/u&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color:=</span><br><span>rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt=</span><br><span>; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline; background-c=</span><br><span>olor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Recent analyses by the Tax Foundation, a grou=</span><br><span>p which uses dynamic scoring methods to judge revenue, have found that Clint=</span><br><span>on=E2=80=99s plan will reduce economic output by 1 percent over a decade, wh=</span><br><span>ile Sanders=E2=80=99 proposals will lower GDP by a staggering 9.5 percent.&amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp; Dynamic scoring is a controversial method of analyzing revenue estimate=</span><br><span>s =E2=80=93 it takes into account the supposed deleterious effects caused by=</span><br><span>tax increases and attempts to adjust growth the reflect those effects.&lt;/spa=</span><br><span>n&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"=</span><br><span>vertical-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;A CRS r=</span><br><span>eport published in 2014, however, stated that =E2=80=9CA review of statistic=</span><br><span>al evidence suggests that both labor supply and savings and investment are r=</span><br><span>elatively insensitive to tax rates.=E2=80=9D&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" s=</span><br><span>tyle=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align:=</span><br><span>baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D=</span><br><span>"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical=</span><br><span>-align: baseline; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;While each camp=</span><br><span>aign will be inclined to&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(2=</span><br><span>55, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;argue that any analysis which mentions economic contracti=</span><br><span>on as an effect of their plans is based on improper economics, it may not ma=</span><br><span>tter to voters whether they=E2=80=99re right or not. &amp;nbsp;American voters h=</span><br><span>ave always been tax-averse but will pay for what they want. &amp;nbsp;Maybe the b=</span><br><span>iggest yet-unanswered question: do they want another overhaul of he nation\'s=</span><br><span>healthcare enough to pay a new record in tax increases?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D=</span><br><span>"ltr" style=3D"margin-top: 0pt; The&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.70=</span><br><span>1961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-de=</span><br><span>coration: -webkit-letterpress; FOMC also indicated a focus on =E2=80=9Clabor market i=</span><br><span>ndicators [which] will continue to strengthen."&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"col=</span><br><span>or: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(130, 98, 8=</span><br><span>3, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; background-color: rgba(=</span><br><span>255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0=</span><br><span>.701961); background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0=</span><br><span>);"&gt;For now, though inflation is running just 0.4 percent, well below its tw=</span><br><span>o percent target, the Fed has not disavowed its plan to raise rates four tim=</span><br><span>es this year. &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This cannot be welcome to global equine markets. &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style=3D"background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Domest=</span><br><span>ic and global capital markets have already lost roughly ten percent since th=</span><br><span>e December rate hike. &amp;nbsp;Fed policy&amp;nbsp;may be having a decelerating eff=</span><br><span>ect on growth and so could be a marginal drag on Democratic prospects. &amp;nbsp=</span><br><span>;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); background-color=</span><br><span>: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Fed watchers have made an art form out of reading=</span><br><span>between the lines of these policy releases, even the most benign of which c=</span><br><span>an cause huge swings in markets (the Dow dropped over 200 points in the wake=</span><br><span>of today=E2=80=99s release).&amp;nbsp; Fed statements are famously difficult to=</span><br><span>parse but one point was unmistakable: the Fed is keeping a close eye on the=</span><br><span>labor market -- employment and participation rates, wages, etc. -- as a lea=</span><br><span>ding indicator for inflation and overall growth perhaps more than any other v=</span><br><span>ariable. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;None of the ca=</span><br><span>ndidates has commented on today=E2=80=99s release, not surprisingly, but the=</span><br><span>policy may draw ire from some on the right, who oppose fiat rate-targeting (=</span><br><span>though it took no action today) and the left, where lowering rather than rai=</span><br><span>sing rate is preferred (except for holders of fixed income securities). &amp;nbs=</span><br><span>p;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rg=</span><br><span>ba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margin-top=</span><br><span>: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline; backgro=</span><br><span>und-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;Sen.&amp;nbsp; Sanders, true to his reputati=</span><br><span>on of standing far outside the Democratic fold, has long opposed the Fed for=</span><br><span>being too involved with the bankers they are meant to be regulating.&amp;nbsp; S=</span><br><span>anders has called for reform measures at the Fed, including prohibiting peop=</span><br><span>le serving on bank boards from serving on the Fed at the same time.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/s=</span><br><span>pan&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;span style=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-f=</span><br><span>ill-color: rgba(130, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpres=</span><br><span>s; background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" styl=</span><br><span>e=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); -webkit-composition-fill-color: rgba(13=</span><br><span>0, 98, 83, 0.0980392); text-decoration: -webkit-letterpress; margin-top: 0pt=</span><br><span>; margin-bottom: 0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style=3D"vertical-align: baseline; background-c=</span><br><span>olor: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0);"&gt;The Fed was confident that economic growth wo=</span><br><span>uld continue on its steady pace, indicating strength in labor markets and do=</span><br><span>wnplaying both financial market reactions and diving commodities prices.&amp;nbs=</span><br><span>p; The FOMC sets monetary policy on a long-term basis; the full ramification=</span><br><span>s of their decisions aren=E2=80=99t felt until months or years out, so any c=</span><br><span>ontention that the economy is strong enough to handle higher interest rates i=</span><br><span>s essentially an endorsement of macroeconomic policy in the last few years. D=</span><br><span>emocratic candidates will need to hammer this point home - but it is yet to b=</span><br><span>e seen if voters will understand the message that Democratic policies are re=</span><br><span>sponsible for the sunny outlook for the American economy, especially compare=</span><br><span>d to Western Europe, Latin America, and Asia.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p dir=3D"ltr" style=</span><br><span>=3D"color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.701961); it=</span><br><span>stronger.=E2=80=9D&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;He has a strong argumen=</span><br><span>t. &amp;nbsp;You can\'t prove a negative and we will never know how many financia=</span><br><span>l crises were averted by Dodd-Frank. &amp;nbsp;But metrics bear out the view tha=</span><br><span>t Americans and the economy have less to fear today from the Systemically Si=</span><br><span>gnificant Financial Institutions (SIFIs) than at any time since the turn of t=</span><br><span>he millennium. &amp;nbsp;More on the regulatory circumstances Survey of the SIFI Landscape=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;The landscape for the eight SIFIs today --=</span><br><span>Bank of America, Bank of regulators powers\', members of Congress are deb=</span><br><span>ating whether to loosen Dodd-Frank Act SIFI rules, and a current Federal Res=</span><br><span>erve Bank president has spoken out in favor of breaking them up. &amp;nbsp;But d=</span><br><span>o SIFIs pose the same threat they did in 2008?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;s=</span><br><span>pan&gt;The Power of DFA&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;President Obama hasn=E2=</span><br><span>=80=99t remained silent in the face of criticism of DFA. &amp;nbsp;After the Mon=</span><br><span>day summit, Obama said that critics are spreading =E2=80=9Ccynicism=E2=80=9D=</span><br><span>: &amp;nbsp;=E2=80=9CIt is popular =E2=80=A6 to suggest that the crisis happened=</span><br><span>and nothing changed. &amp;nbsp;That is not true.=E2=80=9D &amp;nbsp;The President c=</span><br><span>ited the 14 million new jobs created since his inauguration, proof, he said,=</span><br><span>that sensible regulations on Wall Street don=E2=80=99t stifle business grow=</span><br><span>th.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Two major business news stories from 20=</span><br><span>15 support the President=E2=80=99s view: &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>span&gt;=C2=B7 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;General Electric continued to sell off GE Capital, i=</span><br><span>ts $42 billion investment arm, hoping to exit SIFI status in Q1 2016 as a re=</span><br><span>sult of its divestiture. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;=C2=B7 &amp;nbs=</span><br><span>p;&amp;nbsp;MetLife has been embroiled in a legal battle with the Financial Stab=</span><br><span>ility Oversight Council (FSOC) since the regulator announced in December 201=</span><br><span>4 that the insurance company was considered a SIFI =E2=80=93 arguments were h=</span><br><span>eard in New York this January. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;70 percent o=</span><br><span>f DFA has been implemented by the regulatory agencies since it was passed. &amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Despite the constraints on SIFIs, they have by and large adapted w=</span><br><span>ell, making adjustments faster, earlier and more successfully=E2=80=9D than t=</span><br><span>heir overseas counterparts. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;=C2=B7 &amp;nbsp;&amp;=</span><br><span>nbsp;SIFIs now hold much more capital now than they did before the crisis =E2=</span><br><span>=80=93 to the tune of $700 billion in additional capital, twice the amount p=</span><br><span>rior to it&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;=C2=B7 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;SIFIs have th=</span><br><span>ree times the liquidity they had before the crisis&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;b=</span><br><span>r&gt;&lt;span&gt;=C2=B7 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Derivatives clearing houses force transparency on=</span><br><span>SIFI speculation, preventing over-exposure&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>=C2=B7 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;SIFIs now post collateral on their derivatives tra=</span><br></blockquote><span>des&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;=C2=B7 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;SIFIs submit t=</span><br><span>o rigorous stress testing by the Federal Reserve and FDIC &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;=C2=B7 &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;SIFIs are being forced to draft =E2=</span><br><span>=80=9Cliving wills,=E2=80=9D which have already forced some to streamline or=</span><br><span>simplify so they can wind down without requiring a bailout&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Congressional Update&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Congr=</span><br><span>ess is split between those who want to reduce regulatory pressure on big ban=</span><br><span>ks and those who would rather see it ramped up. &amp;nbsp;Sen. Shelby, Senate Ba=</span><br><span>nking Chair, introduced the Financial Regulatory Improvement Act of 2015, a g=</span><br><span>rab-bag of exceptions and exemptions from regulations, mostly for banks with=</span><br><span>between $50 and $500 billion in assets. &amp;nbsp;In a similar vein, Sens Warne=</span><br><span>r, Portman, and Collins introduced the Independent Agency Regulatory Analysi=</span><br><span>s Act to require that regulators undertake a cost-benefit analysis of any ru=</span><br><span>les they wish to implement.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;On the flip sid=</span><br><span>e, Sens. McCain and Warren=E2=80=99s 21st Century Glass-Steagall Act propose=</span><br><span>s to split commercial and investment banks in a bid to finally kill off the T=</span><br><span>BTF problem. &amp;nbsp;Sens. Warren and Vitter teamed up early in 2015 to introd=</span><br><span>uce a package of amendments to the Federal Reserve Act =E2=80=93- that bill n=</span><br><span>otably would set forward stricter regulations when an entity is considered i=</span><br><span>nsolvent, and therefore ineligible for Federal Reserve loans, as well as req=</span><br><span>uire that the Fed lend money to distressed institutions at market rates.&lt;/sp=</span><br><span>an&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;The Regulators\' Agenda &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Under Basel III requirements for large banks to satisfy Liquidity=</span><br></blockquote><span>Coverage Ratios (LCR) were adopted by a number of national regulators, incl=</span><br><span>uding the Federal Reserve. &amp;nbsp;While the Fed has floated a rule change all=</span><br><span>owing some municipal bonds to count as High Quality Liquid Assets (HQLA), th=</span><br><span>at hasn=E2=80=99t stopped Rep. Luke Messer from proposing HR 2209 to force r=</span><br><span>egulators allow a greater share of munis to count as HQLA (see Update, Feb. 1=</span><br><span>8).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;The Fed is also working on implementing=</span><br><span>a rule on Single-Counterparty Credit Limits (SCCL), setting boundaries on c=</span><br><span>redit exposure between large banks or major counterparties. &amp;nbsp;The rule i=</span><br><span>s meant to prevent banks from becoming overexposed to other financial instit=</span><br><span>utions, preventing them from taking overly large losses in the event that th=</span><br><span>e counterparty fails. &amp;nbsp;Analysts suspect that firms are nearly $100 bill=</span><br><span>ion over the limits imposed by this rule, but Yellen says it is necessary to=</span><br><span>set a =E2=80=9Cbright line=E2=80=9D on credit exposure.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/s=</span><br><span>pan&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;SIFIs Moving Forward&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;There is=</span><br><span>no doubt that the upcoming MetLife ruling will be a critical pivot point fo=</span><br><span>r how regulators interact with SIFIs. &amp;nbsp;If the FSOC is required to retra=</span><br><span>ct the firm=E2=80=99s SIFI status it will open the regulator up for a whole s=</span><br><span>lew of challenges from other banks and institutions. &amp;nbsp;The fate of Congr=</span><br><span>essional proposals to restrict regulator=E2=80=99s efforts, either by determ=</span><br><span>ining rules for them or by burdening them with regulations of their own, sho=</span><br><span>uld be seen as the start of a potential sea change in the regulatory climate=</span><br><span>. &amp;nbsp;During his Monday meeting, President Obama warned of this: "If there=</span><br><span>is a significant challenge in terms of regulating Wall Street and regulatin=</span><br><span>g our financial sector it is primarily coming from certain members of Congre=</span><br><span>ss who are consistently pressuring independent regulators to back off.=E2=80=</span><br><span>=9D&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;It is not a bad time to be a SIFI in Am=</span><br><span>erica =E2=80=93 it=E2=80=99s certainly much better to be one now than in 201=</span><br><span>0. &amp;nbsp;While DFA has forced restructuring and streamlining to occur, event=</span><br><span>s like the GE Capital sell-off may prove to be exceptions that prove the rul=</span><br><span>e rather than the new normal for SIFIs, especially if 14)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;spa=</span><br><span>n&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;------&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Mike &amp;amp; Co. --=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;The February jobs report came out this morning better than e=</span><br><span>xpected. &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Once again, the US economy maintained strong job growth=</span><br><span>without wage gains. &amp;nbsp;Wages fell 0.1 percent in February, but 242,000 p=</span><br><span>ositions were added to the economy, marking 72 months of uninterrupted job g=</span><br><span>ains =E2=80=93 the longest streak on record. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;sp=</span><br><span>an&gt;Additionally, labor participation rose by 1.5 million Americans since Nov=</span><br><span>ember =E2=80=93 making it the highest it has been in 16 years (62.9 percent o=</span><br><span>f the overall share of Americans).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;The repo=</span><br><span>rt from Puerto Rico is not as sunny. &amp;nbsp;The territory is still waiting on=</span><br><span>a Congressional bill designed to handle the ongoing debt crisis on the isla=</span><br><span>nd. &amp;nbsp;More &amp;nbsp;below.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Best,&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br=</span><br><blockquote type="cite"><span>&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Dana&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;______________=</span><br></blockquote><span>________________________&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Puerto Rico=E2=80=99=</span><br><span>s Time Bomb&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;The Puerto Rican debt crisis ha=</span><br><span>s been an ongoing concern for both Congress, Wall Street and the Obama admin=</span><br><span>istration for some years now =E2=80=93 the territory=E2=80=99s bond ratings h=</span><br><span>ave been steadily dropping into the junk category and fell from A- in 2005 t=</span><br><span>o CCC+ last April. &amp;nbsp;At the heart of the matter is $70 billion in bonds t=</span><br><span>hat Puerto Rico owes and says it cannot pay on. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;span&gt;Because Puerto Rican bonds are tax exempt in all 50 states and the Dis=</span><br><span>trict of Columbia, making them incredibly popular investments for mutual fun=</span><br><span>ds, pensioners, and big banks. &amp;nbsp;Over 20 percent of mutual funds in the U=</span><br><span>nited States hold at least some Puerto Rican bonds, with $11.3 billion in po=</span><br><span>rtfolio, with a further $15 billion in bonds held by hedge funds. &amp;nbsp;Now t=</span><br><span>hat the territory=E2=80=99s bonds are in the =E2=80=9Cjunk=E2=80=9D category=</span><br><span>, pension funds and insurance firms are unable to hold them any longer.&lt;/spa=</span><br><span>n&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;The diverse list of bond holders has thrown a w=</span><br><span>rench into the plans of those who would rather allow Puerto Rico to default o=</span><br><span>n its obligations =E2=80=93 something which would require legislative action=</span><br><span>(the territory doesn=E2=80=99t have that luxury, unlike states). &amp;nbsp;If P=</span><br><span>uerto Rico is allowed to renege on its contractual agreements, the argument g=</span><br><span>oes, then it creates a moral hazard for other entities to do the same rather=</span><br><span>than make the tough choices necessary to honor their obligations. &amp;nbsp;The=</span><br><span>fact that many of these bonds are essentially held by ordinary Americans (t=</span><br><span>hrough mutual funds and pensions) makes the argument all that stronger for m=</span><br><span>any representatives. &amp;nbsp;A state hasn=E2=80=99t declared bankruptcy since A=</span><br><span>rkansas did so in 1933.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Moral hazard is inh=</span><br><span>erent in a debt restructuring deal; here, the path for Puerto Rico toward ca=</span><br><span>pital markets after anything of the sort would still be an especially painfu=</span><br><span>l one (see: Argentina). &amp;nbsp;Additionally, there are few serious proposals t=</span><br><span>o grant the island full Chapter 9 status. &amp;nbsp;Most opt instead for some fo=</span><br><span>rm of negotiated haircut agreement combined with extending maturities on the=</span><br><span>bonds; these proposals are likely to succeed, considering Puerto Rico is al=</span><br><span>most certainly unable to maintain its bond payment schedule without a restru=</span><br><span>cturing agreement.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Administration Position&lt;=</span><br><span>/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Testifying before the House Committee on Na=</span><br><span>tural Resources on Feb 25, Treasury official Antonio Weiss warned lawmakers t=</span><br><span>hat Puerto Rico needs =E2=80=9Can immediate solution=E2=80=9D if it=E2=80=99=</span><br><span>s to survive past May 1, when a $470 million bond payment is due. &amp;nbsp;Soon=</span><br><span>after that, on July 1, a $1.9 billion bond payment will come due as well =E2=</span><br><span>=80=93 Puerto Rican representatives have already declared they cannot meet t=</span><br><span>hose payments without assistance.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Weiss lai=</span><br><span>d out the administration=E2=80=99s two-part plan: first the territory must b=</span><br><span>e allowed to restructure its debt obligations, second a fiscal oversight boa=</span><br><span>rd should be established to assist the island with managing its finances. &amp;n=</span><br><span>bsp;Importantly, Weiss stopped short of advocating for bankruptcy protection=</span><br><span>for Puerto Rico and told the committee that =E2=80=9Can advisory board is n=</span><br><span>ot adequate to do the job=E2=80=9D alone. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;span&gt;House Democrats voiced concern over the financial oversight board, Rep=</span><br><span>. Luis Guti=C3=A9rrez: =E2=80=9CThey=E2=80=99re saying that there=E2=80=99s a=</span><br><span>joint responsibility, but it seems to me that all of the responsibility is b=</span><br><span>eing weighed on the people of Puerto Rico.=E2=80=9D &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Meanwhile Republicans claimed that any plan to restructure P=</span><br><span>uerto Rican debt was a non-starter; a few hours after the hearing the Republ=</span><br><span>ican Study Committee announced it would oppose any plan including such a pro=</span><br><span>vision. &amp;nbsp;"Changing the rules mid-game would be unfair to Puerto Rico=E2=</span><br><span>=80=99s creditors who entered into these arrangements with agreed upon terms=</span><br><span>and would delegitimize future transactions," said RSC Chairman Bill Flores.=</span><br><span>&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Policy Options&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;=</span><br><span>&lt;span&gt;Until recently the two parties have maintained starkly contrasting vie=</span><br><span>ws on how to best deal with Puerto Rico=E2=80=99s debt crisis =E2=80=93 Demo=</span><br><span>crats have pushed for a forced debt restructuring, with some calling for the=</span><br><span>island to be granted Chapter 9 bankruptcy protections, meanwhile Republican=</span><br><span>s called for a financial oversight council to make the tough fiscal decision=</span><br><span>s necessary for Puerto Rico to maintain its debt obligations without renegin=</span><br><span>g on its agreements.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;The administration, th=</span><br><span>rough Weiss, has advocated a middle of the road approach. By adopting both p=</span><br><span>roposals and avoiding the further edges of each (no bankruptcy, and no unacc=</span><br><span>ountable board staffed by Wall Streeters), the administration hopes to find c=</span><br><span>ompromise between each group. &amp;nbsp;And it seems like it might work.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;=</span><br><span>br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;Finding Compromise&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;spa=</span><br><span>n&gt;Recently, however, the conservative stance against debt restructuring has l=</span><br><span>essened =E2=80=93 with some Republicans saying that they could support a PR b=</span><br><span>ill as long as it doesn=E2=80=99t include Chapter 9 bankruptcy. &amp;nbsp;House N=</span><br><span>atural Resources chair Bob Bishop has been working on a bill for Puerto Rico=</span><br><span>that does include some element of debt restructuring, and recently said =E2=</span><br><span>=80=9C=E2=80=9CI=E2=80=99m sure RSC will be satisfied with what we do =E2=80=</span><br><span>=A6 to say that some element of [debt restructuring] could be in there,
